intro: Oeceoclades cordylinophylla, commonly known as the crested toothbrush plant, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its unique, hairy, and often branched stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Oeceoclades cordylinophylla is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated as a houseplant.
